016
017package org.parboiled.support;
018
019import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.*;
020import java.util.Iterator;
021
022/**
023 * An implementation of a stack of value objects providing an efficient snapshot capability and a number of convenience
024 * methods. The current state of the stack can be saved and restored in small constant time with the methods
025 * {@link #takeSnapshot()} and {@link #restoreSnapshot(Object)} ()}. The implementation also serves as an Iterable
026 * over the current stack values (the values are being provided with the last value (on top of the stack) first).
027 *
028 * @param <V> the type of the value objects
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings({"ConstantConditions"})
031public class DefaultValueStack<V> implements ValueStack<V> {
032
033    protected static class Element {
034        protected final Object value;
035        protected final Element tail;
036
037        protected Element(Object value, Element tail) {
038            this.value = value;
039            this.tail = tail;
040        }
041    }
042
043    protected Element head;
044    protected V tempValue;
045
046    /**
047     * Initializes an empty value stack.
048     */
049    public DefaultValueStack() {
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Initializes a value stack containing the given values with the last value being at the top of the stack.
054     *
055     * @param values the initial stack values
056     */
057    public DefaultValueStack(Iterable<V> values) {
058        pushAll(values);
059    }
060
061    public boolean isEmpty() {
062        return head == null;
063    }
064
065    public int size() {
066        Element cursor = head;
067        int size = 0;
068        while (cursor != null) {
069            size++;
070            cursor = cursor.tail;
071        }
072        return size;
073    }
074
075    public void clear() {
076        head = null;
077    }
078
079    public Object takeSnapshot() {
080        return head;
081    }
082
083    public void restoreSnapshot(Object snapshot) {
084        try {
085            head = (Element) snapshot;
086        } catch (ClassCastException e) {
087            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Given argument '" + snapshot + "' is not a valid snapshot element");
088        }
089    }
090
091    public void push(V value) {
092        head = new Element(value, head);
093    }
094
095    public void push(int down, V value) {
096        head = push(down, value, head);
097    }
098
099    private static Element push(int down, Object value, Element head) {
100        if (down == 0) return new Element(value, head);
101        checkArgument(head != null, "Cannot push beyond the bottom of the stack");
102        if (down > 0) return new Element(head.value, push(down - 1, value, head.tail));
103        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Argument 'down' must not be negative");
104    }
105
106    public void pushAll(V firstValue, V... moreValues) {
107        push(firstValue);
108        for (V value : moreValues) push(value);
109    }
110
111    public void pushAll(Iterable<V> values) {
112        head = null;
113        for (V value : values) push(value);
114    }
115
116    public V pop() {
117        return pop(0);
118    }
119
120    public V pop(int down) {
121        head = pop(down, head);
122        V result = tempValue;
123        tempValue = null; // avoid memory leak
124        return result;
125    }
126
127    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
128    private Element pop(int down, Element head) {
129        checkArgument(head != null, "Cannot pop from beyond the bottom of the stack");
130        if (down == 0) {
131            tempValue = (V) head.value;
132            return head.tail;
133        }
134        if (down > 0) return new Element(head.value, pop(down - 1, head.tail));
135        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Argument 'down' must not be negative");
136    }
137
138    public V peek() {
139        return peek(0);
140    }
141
142    @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
143    public V peek(int down) {
144        return (V) peek(down, head);
145    }
146
147    @SuppressWarnings({"ConstantConditions"})
148    private static Object peek(int down, Element head) {
149        checkArgument(head != null, "Cannot peek beyond the bottom of the stack");
150        if (down == 0) return head.value;
151        if (down > 0) return peek(down - 1, head.tail);
152        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Argument 'down' must not be negative");
153    }
154
155    public void poke(V value) {
156        poke(0, value);
157    }
158
159    public void poke(int down, V value) {
160        head = poke(down, value, head);
161    }
162
163    private static Element poke(int down, Object value, Element head) {
164        checkArgument(head != null, "Cannot poke beyond the bottom of the stack");
165        if (down == 0) return new Element(value, head.tail);
166        if (down > 0) return new Element(head.value, poke(down - 1, value, head.tail));
167        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Argument 'down' must not be negative");
168    }
169
170    public void dup() {
171        push(peek());
172    }
173
174    public void swap() {
175        Checks.ensure(isSizeGTE(2, head), "Swap not allowed on stack with less than two elements");
176        Element down1 = head.tail;
177        head = new Element(down1.value, new Element(head.value, down1.tail));
178    }
179
180    public void swap3() {
181        Checks.ensure(isSizeGTE(3, head), "Swap3 not allowed on stack with less than 3 elements");
182        Element down1 = head.tail;
183        Element down2 = down1.tail;
184        head = new Element(down2.value, new Element(down1.value, new Element(head.value, down2.tail)));
185    }
186
187    public void swap4() {
188        Checks.ensure(isSizeGTE(4, head), "Swap4 not allowed on stack with less than 4 elements");
189        Element down1 = head.tail;
190        Element down2 = down1.tail;
191        Element down3 = down2.tail;
192        head = new Element(down3.value, new Element(down2.value, new Element(down1.value, new Element(head.value,
193                down3.tail))));
194    }
195
196    public void swap5() {
197        Checks.ensure(isSizeGTE(5, head), "Swap5 not allowed on stack with less than 5 elements");
198        Element down1 = head.tail;
199        Element down2 = down1.tail;
200        Element down3 = down2.tail;
201        Element down4 = down3.tail;
202        head = new Element(down4.value, new Element(down3.value, new Element(down2.value, new Element(down1.value,
203                new Element(head.value, down4.tail)))));
204    }
205
206    public void swap6() {
207        Checks.ensure(isSizeGTE(6, head), "Swap6 not allowed on stack with less than 6 elements");
208        Element down1 = head.tail;
209        Element down2 = down1.tail;
210        Element down3 = down2.tail;
211        Element down4 = down3.tail;
212        Element down5 = down4.tail;
213        head = new Element(down5.value, new Element(down4.value, new Element(down3.value, new Element(down2.value,
214                new Element(down1.value, new Element(head.value, down5.tail))))));
215    }
216
217    private static boolean isSizeGTE(int minSize, Element head) {
218        return minSize == 1 ? head != null : isSizeGTE(minSize - 1, head.tail);
219    }
220
221    public Iterator<V> iterator() {
222        return new Iterator<V>() {
223            private Element next = head;
224            public boolean hasNext() {
225                return next != null;
226            }
227            @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
228            public V next() {
229                V value = (V) next.value;
230                next = next.tail;
231                return value;
232            }
233            public void remove() {
234                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
235            }
236        };
237    }
238}
